TEXT.TITLE: EXPORT BONUS WHEAT FLOUR TO IRAQ --USDA
TEXT.BODY: The Commodity Credit Corporation (CCC) accepted a bid for an export bonus to cover a sale of 12,500 tonnes of U.S. wheat flour to Iraq, the U.S. Agriculture Department said. The department said the bonus awarded was 105.82 dlrs per tonne and the wheat flour is for shipment July 1-10, 1987. The bonus was awarded to The Pillsbury Company and will be paid in the form of commodities from CCC stocks. An additional 150,000 tonnes of wheat flour is still available to Iraq under the Export Enhancement Program initiative announced January 7, 1987, the department said. Reuter
